title: install win7pe or vistape on usb and encrypt whole usb wit truecrypt or smth ? how ?

forumNotes.author: matx
forumNotes.content: is this possible- install win7pe or vista pe on usb pendrive and ENCRYPT whole usb pendrive with truecrypt or diskcryptor ? to boot vistape or win7pe from encryp\[ted pendrive usb - pre boot authentication password and than boot how ?

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content:
Following is my experience with BartPE (UBCD4Win in fact) and TrueCrypt (TC).  
At least you need to add TrueCrypt plug-in for BartPE, so the protected driver will be loaded.  
Once the whole disk in encrypted, after preboot authentication (PBA) phase, TrueCrypt code in MBR  
will decode the data during real-mode disk access, afterwards normally the protected mode TrueCrypt driver  
loaded by BartPE would be active in turn. This is how I understand the TC mechanism.  

Unfortunately I did not success to get the whole process running. As far as I remember, there is a loading   
error message at the beginning of BartPE.  

Since then I use another method. Normally BartPE/VistaPE/Win7PE does not contain confidential data and so  
does not need encryption. I use bootice (or Hitachi microfilter) to partition the USB key into 2 partitions,  
the first one is visible by normal Windows, it contains normal BartPE + Hitachi microfilter plug-in + TC plugin (so that when loaded the second partition truecrypted could be mounted and seen). The second partition (active) contains XP OS and is encrypted.  

At USB key boot, I have grub4dos using menu.lst to choose between normal BartPE (first partition boot), and TrueCrypt (second partition, encrypted) boot (by using grub4dos chainloading the TC MBR). My second partition contains USBooted ( [http://www.usboot.org)](http://www.usboot.org) "External link") XP.  

Of course if you do not need full OS encrypted boot, the second partition could be simply data partition, and you can mount it inside BartPE (or from other computers with TC).
